The Netherlands is a country located in Northwestern Europe with overseas territories in the Caribbean.
The Netherlands is also known as Holland.
The Netherlands is the largest of the four constituent countries of the Kingdom of the Netherlands.
The Netherlands consists of twelve provinces.
The Netherlands borders Germany to the east and Belgium to the south.
The Netherlands has a North Sea coastline to the north and west.
The Netherlands shares maritime borders with the United Kingdom, Germany, and Belgium.
The official language of the Netherlands is Dutch.
West Frisian is a secondary official language in the province of Friesland.
Dutch, English, and Papiamento are official languages in the Caribbean territories.
Netherlands literally means 'lower countries' in reference to its low elevation and flat topography.
26% of the Netherlands is situated below sea level.
Most areas below sea level are known as polders, which are the result of land reclamation that began in the 14th century.

The Netherlands entered a unique era of political, economic, and cultural greatness in the Republican period, which began in 1588.
This period is known as the Dutch Golden Age.
During the Dutch Golden Age, the Netherlands' trading companies established colonies and trading posts all over the world.

The population of the Netherlands is over 17.9 million people.
The total area of the Netherlands is 41,850 km2 (16,160 sq mi).
The land area of the Netherlands is 33,500 km2 (12,900 sq mi).
The Netherlands is the 33rd most densely populated country.
The density of population in the Netherlands is 535 people per square kilometre (1,390 people/sq mi).
The Netherlands is the world's second-largest exporter of food and agricultural products by value.

The four largest cities in the Netherlands are Amsterdam, Rotterdam, The Hague, and Utrecht.
Amsterdam is the country's most populous city and the nominal capital.
The primary national political institutions are located in The Hague.
The Netherlands has been a parliamentary constitutional monarchy with a unitary structure since 1848.
The country has a tradition of pillarisation (separation of citizens into groups by religion and political beliefs).
The Netherlands has a long record of social tolerance, having legalised prostitution and euthanasia.
The Netherlands maintains a liberal drug policy.

Women's suffrage was allowed in the Netherlands in 1919.
The Netherlands was the first country to legalise same-sex marriage in 2001.

The mixed-market advanced economy of the Netherlands has the eleventh-highest per capita income globally.
The Hague holds the seat of the States General, Cabinet, and Supreme Court.
The Port of Rotterdam is the busiest in Europe.
Schiphol is the busiest airport in the Netherlands and the fourth busiest in Europe.

The Netherlands is a founding member of the European Union, Eurozone, G10, NATO, OECD, and WTO.
The Netherlands is part of the Schengen Area and the trilateral Benelux Union.
